parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cause to drink, give to drink; irrigate, water. From a derivative of the alternate of pino; to furnish drink, irrigate.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
A drinking cup, the contents of the cup; fig: the portion which God allots.
Cool, cold; fig: cold-hearted. From psuchos; chilly.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Little, small. Including the comparative mikroteros apparently a primary word; small (figuratively) dignity).
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.
